articles.author: Joel Sked
articles.description: Scottish FA chief executive Ian Maxwell, speaking ahead of the organisation’s Week of Football initiative as part of the 150th anniversary celebrations, has addressed three controversial topics within Scottish football: Moving the kick-off time of the Scottish Cup, VAR and the proposed introduction of the Conference League.
articles.title: What SFA chief Ian Maxwell said on VAR, Conference League, Scottish Cup final kick-off time switch

articles.author: Joel Sked
articles.description: There is less than a week left of the Scottish Premiership season with two rounds of fixtures over the next six days with the European and relegation places still to be decided. Meanwhile clubs are well into plans for next season regarding arrivals and departures.
articles.title: Scottish transfers: Rangers star in talks with EPL trio, bid for £13m-rated Celtic target. Hearts midfielder exits

articles.author: Mark Atkinson
articles.description: Tottenham Hotspur continue to be linked with Celtic boss Ange Postecoglou as they mull over who to appoint as their manager for next season.
articles.title: Ange Postecoglou link that won't go away: Celtic manager 'on four-man shortlist' for Spurs but other candidate far likelier

articles.author: Graeme Macpherson
articles.description: Curtis Main has revealed that St Mirren deliberately targeted Tomoki Iwata ahead of their 2-2 draw with Celtic.
articles.title: St Mirren reveal Celtic player who was deliberately targeted in 2-2 draw - 'it's not something you would ignore'

articles.author: Graeme Macpherson
articles.description: Given the almost childlike enthusiasm with which he energetically celebrates every victory, it should probably not come as a huge surprise to see Kyogo Furuhashi continue to whizz around the park in these end-of-season dead rubber contests as if his life depended on it.
articles.title: Kyogo Furuhashi eyes permanent place on Celtic Park walls as striker spared from St Mirren criticism

articles.author: Alison McConnell
articles.description: Fran Alonso’s Miami Vice look was back at Celtic Park yesterday afternoon. By the time this game was over, however, the look was spoiled by the need for a sick bag.
articles.title: Celtic, Rangers and Glasgow City serve up 'movie' climax as SWPL trophy arrives at Parkhead only to depart for Ibrox

articles.author: Matthew Elder
articles.description: Glasgow City have emerged as champions with Rangers and Celtic left dejected after a thrilling climax to the Scottish Women's Premier League season.
articles.title: Celtic and Rangers dejection as Glasgow City clinch SWPL title after stoppage time drama at Ibrox

articles.author: Matthew Elder
articles.description: One of Celtic, Rangers or Glasgow City will be crowned Scottish Women's Premier League champions on Sunday as an epic three-way battle for the title reaches a dramatic conclusion.
articles.title: What channel is Rangers v Glasgow City? What channel is Celtic Women v Hearts? TV details for SWPL title deciders

articles.author: Alison McConnell
articles.description: There is no need for helicopters to change direction when the distance to Ibrox or Celtic Park is a simple hop, skip and a jump away. This afternoon’s motorbike outrider, however, would be better served with an abacus rather than a sat nav.
articles.title: SWPL final day: Glasgow City, Celtic and Rangers all set for title shootout - the numbers will add up for someone

articles.author: Andrew Smith
articles.description: A dynamic St Mirren came close to giving Celtic a real bloody nose in the champions’ own backyard BY twice taking the lead before being pegged back in the clubs’ 2-2 draw. The encounter betrayed that Ange Postecoglou’s men are struggling to retain their edge post-title win and engendered some random musings.
articles.title: Celtic reaction: Crowd drift telling; Lisbon Lions high still beatable; few cup final concerns

articles.author: Andrew Smith
articles.description: For a team that purports to never stop, Celtic are giving an awfully strong impression of having begun to grind to a halt.
articles.title: Celtic transformed from Ferrari to jalopy in latest misfire

articles.author: Andrew Smith
articles.description: St Mirren manager Stephen Robinson believes his players did not receive their just desserts for a fizzing display against the champions in their own backyard.
articles.title: St Mirren manager Stephen Robinson in 'we deserved to win' claim following Celtic Park showing

articles.author: Andrew Smith
articles.description: Celtic manager Ange Postecoglou accepted his team have deviated from their core principles following their struggles that required them to twice come from behind to dig out a 2-2 draw with a vibrant St Mirren.
articles.title: Ange Postecoglou makes 'heavyweight champion of world' comment after questions over St Mirren draw

articles.author: Andrew Smith
articles.description: It is an unenviable high wire act that James Bizgrove must perform as he steps into the role of Rangers chief executive.
articles.title: Rangers CEO James Bisgrove has say on Celtic threat to most successful club in world status

articles.author: Mark Atkinson
articles.description: There should be a carnival atmosphere at Parkhead this afternoon as the majority of the Celtic support get their first chance to acclaim their freshly-crowned champions.
articles.title: Seville memories and 'sensational' Man City whet Celtic's European appetite as champions prepare to return home

articles.author: Joel Sked
articles.description: As things stand, Liam Scales will report to Celtic for pre-season after taking a much-needed holiday following an Aberdeen season which has been somewhat of a rollercoaster.
articles.title: What Liam Scales said about Aberdeen and Celtic future, pre-season plans and his 'love' playing for the Dons

articles.author: Matthew Elder
articles.description: Graeme Souness has held “informal” talks with Rangers over the prospect of returning to the club in an ambassadorial capacity.
articles.title: Rangers lift lid on Graeme Souness talks and confirm 'maximum' Celtic away allocation next season

articles.author: Joel Sked
articles.description: Ange Postecoglou is one of four nominees for the Scottish Football Writers’ Association’s Manager of the Year award.
articles.title: Celtic boss Ange Postecoglou, two Premiership rivals and title winner nominated for SFWA Manager of the Year

articles.author: Chris Andrews
articles.description: Celtic are set to hand goalkeeper Scott Bain a new three-year-deal despite not having featured this season.
articles.title: Celtic star set for surprise 3-year-deal as EPL duo target highly-rated defender

articles.author: Matthew Elder
articles.description: He is one of the most relied upon players in Scottish football but you won't catch Callum McGregor asking for a rest.
articles.title: Inside Callum McGregor's Celtic longevity - why no rest required ahead of the Scottish Cup final

articles.author: Matthew Elder
articles.description: He is one of the most relied upon players in Scottish football but you won't catch Callum McGregor asking for a rest.
articles.title: Inside Callum McGregor's Celtic longevity - why no rest required ahead of Scottish Cup final

articles.author: Joel Sked
articles.description: Aberdeen boss Barry Robson has called on Scottish clubs to “get together” regarding away supporters.
articles.title: Barry Robson expresses away fan desire as Aberdeen to be backed by 600 at Tynecastle for Hearts clash

articles.author: Matthew Elder
articles.description: Callum McGregor has no doubts that Celtic can maintain their status as the top dogs in Scottish football despite Rangers outlining plans to knock them off their perch.
articles.title: Callum McGregor issues defiant Celtic response to Rangers defeat and James Bisgrove claims

articles.description: Rangers will finish the season trophyless after Celtic won their second successive League Cup and Premiership title.
articles.title: Chris Sutton mocks Kenny Miller's Celtic vs Rangers 'toe-to-toe' claim

articles.description: Celtic's most decorated player and an eventual place in the dugout? Neil Lennon believes anything is possible for Callum McGregor.
articles.title: Lennon predicts future for Celtic star with 'attributes' to be manager

articles.description: The summer is fast approaching as Celtic look to strengthen for next season's Champions League.
articles.title: The Celtic transfer positions Ange Postecoglou may look to address

articles.description: The Scottish FA have confirmed the refereeing appointments for the showpiece final.
articles.title: Referee named for Celtic vs Inverness Scottish Cup final

articles.description: The Parkhead boss is included in a four-man shortlist for the Premier League position.
articles.title: Tottenham manager latest as Celtic's Postecoglou remains on shortlist

articles.description: Ange Postecoglou's side have two games remaining against Hibs and Aberdeen.
articles.title: The Celtic record on the line as champions could surpass Lisbon Lions

articles.description: Fran Alonso has told his players that they have changed the landscape of Scottish women’s football despite failing to land a first SWPL title this season.There was heartbreak for Celtic after they came within two minutes of winning their inaugural league with an emotional Alonso left to console his visibly distraught players in the aftermath of an afternoon when they were so near yet so far.
articles.title: Fran Alonso: Forget title, Celtic changed Scottish women's football

articles.description: The Scottish Women's Premier League draws to a close this Sunday with three clubs still in with a chance of lifting the title we are in for a huge afternoon of action. Glasgow City, Celtic and Rangers can all still become champions, but who can hold their nerve? Stay tuned on our LIVE blog to find out.
articles.title: Glasgow City win the SWPL title as Celtic and Rangers fall short

articles.description: The Scottish Women's Premier League draws to a close this Sunday with three clubs still in with a chance of lifting the title we are in for a huge afternoon of action. Glasgow City, Celtic and Rangers can all still become champions, but who can hold their nerve? Stay tuned on our LIVE blog to find out.
articles.title: Rangers, Celtic & Glasgow City go for title LIVE: SWPL Helicopter Sunday

articles.description: On the 20th anniversary of a historic event, the fans who were there share their stories and memories.
articles.title: Celtic fans recall skipping exams and getting engaged in Seville

articles.description: Three teams have a realistic chance of winning the title, and the women's domestic game may finally get its afternoon in the spotlight.
articles.title: SWPL promises to deliver final day drama

articles.description: Ange Postecoglou fired back at critics as Celtic failed to defeat St Mirren.
articles.title: Ange Postecoglou in Celtic 'heavyweight champion' response to critics

articles.description: dsak;dnas
articles.title: Celtic 2 St Mirren 2: Instant reaction to the burning issues

articles.description: The Scottish champions are looking to get back on track after the defeat to Rangers.
articles.title: Celtic team news vs St Mirren as Postecoglou names starting XI

articles.description: It's now the Scottish champions' turn to play on home soil as they welcome St Mirren to the east end of Glasgow this weekend.
articles.title: Celtic vs St Mirren: Live stream, TV channel & team news

articles.description: The Parkhead assistant is looking forward to another crack at the Champions League next season.
articles.title: John Kennedy draws Man City parallels with Celtic under Ange

articles.description: Ally McCoist has branded Chris Sutton 'disrespectful'.
articles.title: Ally McCoist brands Chris Sutton 'disrespectful' after Rangers dig

articles.description: John Kennedy believes the defeat to Rangers last week will be a key learning experience for Celtic.
articles.title: Kennedy says Rangers defeat is learning experience for Celtic squad

articles.description: The Buddies boss confirmed the decision was made at a higher level.
articles.title: St Mirren won't give Celtic guard of honour at Parkhead

articles.description: Keeper Scott Bain has struggled for minutes and was expected to move on after Benjamin Siegrist's arrival in the summer.
articles.title: Celtic fringe player 'agrees three-year contract extension'

articles.description: The Parkhead skipper was in the youth academy when Martin O'Neill's iconic team reached the UEFA Cup final.
articles.title: Callum McGregor on key difference for Celtic in next Champions League

articles.description: New Ibrox CEO James Bisgrove this week said the club had a plan in place to return to the top of Scottish football by 2025.
articles.title: Celtic captain Callum McGregor bats away Rangers 'dominant team' claim
